text: VIVA LA $MELI

Emerging markets were one of my core 2026 calls & LatAm is the cleanest expression of that theme.

$MELI is the only player that owns the marketplace, the payments rail, the credit engine, the logistics network & now the automation layer tying it all together.
$QCOM is positioning itself as the ‚Äúbrain‚Äù for edge robotics like drones, autonomous machines & on-device AI systems where decisions need to be made locally with minimal power.

Daniel & I started the @FuturumEquities Podcast last summer to break down the AI economy in real time.

One of our earliest core themes was that AI servers need ~5x more DRAM capacity than traditional servers. 

That reality is why $MU is positioned where it is in this AI cycle.

Goldman Sachs expects global humanoid robot market to reach $38B within next decade.

‚Ä¢ $NVDA supplying the intelligence layer
‚Ä¢ $AMZN automating the logistics layer
‚Ä¢ $TSLA building physical embodiment layer
‚Ä¢ $PLTR coordinating the control layer

I initiated a $ONDS position long before drones became a popular theme based on the view that they could become the secure communications layer for autonomous systems that lets drones talk to each other safely.

Having conviction before the market sees it is the whole game.

Samsung & SK Hynix are quoting cloud customers like $MSFT, $AMZN & $GOOGL server DRAM prices 60‚Äì70% above Q4 levels. 

This move effectively pulls $MU into the same pricing umbrella as the memory shortage turns ‚Äúunprecedented.‚Äù

2023 was about GPUs
2024 was about networking
2025 was about memory
2026 is about agentic AI

The enormous caveat is that OPEC just publishes the numbers given to them by its members without any independent audit. In late 2000s, Chavez tripled the reported reserves without commensurate new exploration, seeking increased int'l and domestic prestige. 300 billion is made up.

6/6

Note bond market yields are rising as crude oil prices fall (gray box).

If crude oil prices do fall, will this "recouple" crude oil prices and yields for more than a day or two?

5/6

After peaking at near $130 in March 2022 (Ukraine war), crude oil prices have been in a consistent downtrend.

Considering crude has been falling for 45 months, what bullish news is priced in that will be taken out (falling prices) because of what happened in Venezuela?

3/6

Ditto the 30-year yield

2/6

The US 10-year yield closed Friday at its highest level since early September.

Given the news from Venezuela over the weekend, how much will it fall tomorrow (Monday)? Will it fall tomorrow?

1/6

Where do bond markets stand ahead of the Venezuela news?

5/5

Venezuela has plenty of economic potential after 2030. But little will change to impact world markets (particularly crude oil production) in the weeks/months/few years in the immediate future.

2/5

Venezuela is a founding member of OPEC their official statistics show its production (blue) is down 71% from its 1998 peak.

Its sustainable capacity (max output in within 90 days and held for a year) is 1M barrels/day (orange).

Venezuela is at its maximum now.

1/5

Thoughts on market reaction to the Venezuela news.

tl:dr

The spigot in Venezuela waiting to be opened to flood the world with crude oil and lower its price has been broken for a while.

It will take several years to fix it.

BofA says AI capabilities are still the main asset and valuation driver for large-cap Internet. With infra spend rising across the mega caps, they think proprietary chips, frontier models, user data, and scaled consumer distribution matter even more. 

They expect 2026 to bring ‚Äúmarket-moving‚Äù AI announcements, and call 2027 mega-cap Internet valuations attractive at ~22x P/E vs ~20x for the S&P given the growing AI asset base and faster revenue growth. 

Their list of potential, stretch, and big-stretch catalysts includes $AMZN and OpenAI doing agentic commerce, $GOOGL and $AAPL signing an AI mobile partnership, $META rolling out AI video creation tools across its apps, $UBER landing an L4 AV commitment with a major Asian OEM, Booking $BKNG launching chat-based booking, DoorDash $DASH expanding delivery with AV partners, and 2026 AI IPOs setting a valuation framework for the sector.
